newsitem.title: UK: BP's Algerian JV in gas supply deal with ENEL.
newsitem.headline: BP's Algerian JV in gas supply deal with ENEL.

text.p: British Petroleum Co Plc (BP) said on Tuesday its In Salah Gas joint venture has signed a "major" gas supply deal with Italian power generating giant ENEL.
The In Salah Gas marketing JV was launched today by BP and Algerian state oil company firm Sonatrach to bring the next tranche of Algerian natural gas to Europe.

In Salah, taking over an existing contract between Sonatrach and ENEL (Ente Nazionale per l'Energia Elettrica SpA ), will be responsible for supplying ENEL with four billion cubic metres of natural gas each year.
Deliveries began under the existing contract towards the end of 1996 and will continue to be met by Sonatrach until the first gas is produced by In Salah.

Ahmed Messili, general manager of In Salah said the ENEL deal is a good start for the joint venture, adding that the project "has every expectation that the reserve base will be sufficient to fulfil gas sales commitments of nine to 11 billion cubic metres a year for decades to come."
This is the first sales announcement made by In Salah.

"I am sure that the combination of Sonatrach's and BP's expertise and experience will make In Salah Gas a powerful new force in the European gas market," Sonatrach's chief executive Nazim Charif Eddine Zouioueche said in a statement.
The launch of In Salah follows a contract signed in December 1995 between BP and Sonatrach to explore, develop and market gas jointly from the In Salah region in southern Algeria.
Rodney Chase, chief executive of BP Exploration, welcomed the launch of the joint venture.
"Now comes the vital appraisal phase as we week to confirm the extent of the gas reserves in the region and finalise the development plan," he added.
